work.description: Start working on the next available PR following parallel agent coordination rules
work.prompt:
file:.claude/agent-defaults.md
file:.claude/agent-identity.md

You are starting a new work session.

1. First, claim an agent identity:
   - Read .claude/agent-identity-lock.md to see available identities
   - Take the first Available identity (White, Orange, Blonde, Pink, Blue, or Brown)
   - Update the lock file to mark it as In Use
   - Commit the identity claim immediately

2. Then, review docs/prd.md and docs/task-list.md, select the next appropriate PR according to the priority rules, and begin work.

3. Remember: When you complete or suspend your PR, release your identity in agent-identity-lock.md and commit that change.

Follow commit-policy.md - only auto-commit coordination documents (task-list.md, prd.md, agent-identity-lock.md).

qc.description: Run quality control checks on completed PRs
qc.prompt:
file:.claude/qc-agent.md

Run a full QC check. Review all Complete PRs in docs/task-list.md, run tests, check coverage, and mark as Broken/Approved/Certified as appropriate.

plan.description: Generate PRD and task list from project spec (usage: /plan <spec location and additional instructions>)
plan.prompt:
file:.claude/agent-planning.md

$ARGUMENTS

Generate a comprehensive PRD and task list following the planning guidelines.

status.description: Show current project status and what each agent is working on
status.prompt:
Review docs/task-list.md and give me a summary:
- Which PRs are In Progress and who's working on them
- Which PRs are Blocked-Ready and what they're waiting for
- Which PRs are Broken and need fixing
- Which PRs are Complete
- Any file lock conflicts or coordination issues
